description: Shifts 2 places left under boustrophedon transform.
references: G. W. Hill, Acta Mathematica, VIII (1886).
links: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..480
J. Millar, N. J. A. Sloane and N. E. Young, A new operation on sequences: the Boustrophedon on transform, J. Combin. Theory, 17A 44-54 1996 (Abstract, pdf, ps).
N. J. A. Sloane, My favorite integer sequences, in Sequences and their Applications (Proceedings of SETA '98).
Index entries for sequences related to boustrophedon transform
mathematica: nmax = 30; sectan = Normal[Series[Sec[x] + Tan[x], {x, 0, nmax+1}]]; Subscript[a,0]=1; Subscript[a,1]=0; egf = Sum[Subscript[a,k]*x^k, {k,0,nmax+1}]; Table[Subscript[a,k]*k!, {k,0,nmax}] /.Solve[Take[CoefficientList[Expand[ sectan*egf - D[egf,{x,2}]],x], nmax-1] == ConstantArray[0, nmax-1]][[1]] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 12 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
